node.name: Common Commands
node.description: These commands are available on all VTY nodes. They are listed here only once, to unclutter the VTY reference.

param.name: help
param.doc: Description of the interactive help system

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: [PATH]
param.doc: Set file path to store the config, or replace if already exists

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: memory
param.doc: Write configuration to the file (same as write file)

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: exit
param.doc: Exit current mode and down to previous mode

param.name: end
param.doc: End current mode and change to enable mode.

param.name: length
param.doc: Set number of lines on a screen
Number of lines on screen (0 for no pausing)

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: length
param.doc: Set number of lines on a screen

param.name: all
param.doc: Do you want to log all messages?
Only print messages matched by other filters
Bypass filter and print all messages
Don't use color for printing messages
Prefix each log message with current timestamp
Prefix each log message with current timestamp with YYYYMMDDhhmmssnnn
Prefix each log message with category/subsystem name
Prefix each log message with category/subsystem nr in hex ('<000b>')
Prefix each log message with the log level name
Prefix each log message with the source file and line

param.name: basename
param.doc: Prefix each log message with the source file's basename (strip leading paths) and line

param.name: [last]
param.doc: Log source file info at the end of a log line. If omitted, log source file info just before the log text.

param.name: set-log-mask
param.doc: Set the logmask of this logging target

param.name: MASK
param.doc: List of logging categories to log, e.g. 'abc:mno:xyz'. Available log categories depend on the specific application, refer to the 'logging level' command. Optionally add individual log levels like 'abc,1:mno,3:xyz,5', where the level numbers are LOGL_DEBUG=1 LOGL_INFO=3 LOGL_NOTICE=5 LOGL_ERROR=7 LOGL_FATAL=8

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: set-all
param.doc: Once-off set all categories to the given log level. There is no single command to take back these changes -- each category is set to the given level, period.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: force-all
param.doc: Globally force all logging categories to a specific level. This is released by the 'no logging level force-all' command. Note: any 'logging level <category> <level>' commands will have no visible effect after this, until the forced level is released.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: force-all
param.doc: Release any globally forced log level set with 'logging level force-all <level>'

param.name: logp
param.doc: Print a message on all log outputs; useful for placing markers in test logs

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error

param.name: .LOGMESSAGE
param.doc: Arbitrary message to log on given category and log level

Send all stats even if they have not changed (i.e. force the flush)every N-th reporting interval. Set to 0 to disable regular flush (default).

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: bind
param.doc: Accept VTY telnet connections on local interface

param.name: description
param.doc: Save human-readable description of the object

param.name: .TEXT
param.doc: Text until the end of the line

param.name: dynamic-permitted
param.doc: Dynamically allocate Routing Keys for what ASPs request

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: route-table
param.doc: Specify the name of the route table

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: listen
param.doc: Disable xUA Listener on given SCTP Port

param.name: sccp-timer
param.doc: Configure SCCP timer values, see ITU-T Q.714

param.name: conn_est
param.doc: Waiting for connection confirm message, 1 to 2 minutes (default: 60)

param.name: ias
param.doc: Send keep-alive: on an idle connection, delay before sending an Idle Timer message, 5 to 10 minutes (default: 420)

param.name: iar
param.doc: Receive keep-alive: on an idle connection, delay until considering a connection as stale, 11 to 21 minutes (default: 900)

param.name: rel
param.doc: Waiting for release complete message, 10 to 20 seconds (default: 10)

param.name: repeat_rel
param.doc: Waiting for release complete message; or to repeat sending released message after the initial expiry, 10 to 20 seconds (default: 10)

param.name: int
param.doc: Waiting for release complete message; or to release connection resources, freeze the LRN and alert a maintenance function after the initial expiry, extending to 1 minute (default: 60)

param.name: guard
param.doc: Waiting to resume normal procedure for temporary connection sections during the restart procedure, 23 to 25 minutes (default: 1380)

param.name: reset
param.doc: Waiting to release temporary connection section or alert maintenance function after reset request message is sent, 10 to 20 seconds (default: 10)

param.name: reassembly
param.doc: Waiting to receive all the segments of the remaining segments, single segmented message after receiving the first segment, 10 to 20 seconds (default: 10)

param.name: description
param.doc: Save human-readable description of the object

param.name: .TEXT
param.doc: Text until the end of the line

param.name: asp
param.doc: Specify that a given ASP is part of this AS

param.name: NAME
param.doc: Name of ASP to be added to AS

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: asp
param.doc: Specify ASP to be removed from this AS

param.name: NAME
param.doc: Name of ASP to be removed

param.name: traffic-mode
param.doc: Specifies traffic mode of operation of the ASP within the AS

param.name: broadcast
param.doc: Broadcast to all ASP within AS

param.name: loadshare
param.doc: Share Load among all ASP within AS

param.name: roundrobin
param.doc: Round-Robin between all ASP within AS

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: traffic-mode
param.doc: Remove explicit traffic mode of operation of this AS

param.name: recovery-timeout
param.doc: Specifies the recovery timeout value in milliseconds

command.id: routing-key RCONTEXT DPC si (aal2|bicc|b-isup|h248|isup|sat-isup|sccp|tup) ssn SSN

param.name: override
param.doc: Override (force) a point-code to hard-coded value

param.name: override
param.doc: Override (force) a point-code to hard-coded value

param.name: patch-sccp
param.doc: Patch point code values into SCCP called/calling address

param.name: disabled
param.doc: Don't patch any point codes into SCCP called/calling address

param.name: both
param.doc: Patch both origin and destination point codes into SCCP called/calling address

param.name: description
param.doc: Save human-readable description of the object

param.name: .TEXT
param.doc: Text until the end of the line

param.name: remote-ip
param.doc: Specify Remote IP Address of ASP

param.name: local-ip
param.doc: Specify Local IP Address from which to contact ASP

param.name: A.B.C.D
param.doc: Local IPv4 Address from which to contact of ASP

param.name: X:X::X:X
param.doc: Local IPv6 Address from which to contact of ASP

param.name: role
param.doc: Specify the xUA role for this ASP

param.name: sctp-role
param.doc: Specify the SCTP role for this ASP

param.name: client
param.doc: Operate as SCTP client; connect to a server

param.name: server
param.doc: Operate as SCTP server; wait for client connections

param.name: block
param.doc: Allows a SCTP Association with ASP, but doesn't let it become active

param.name: shutdown
param.doc: Terminates SCTP association; New associations will be rejected

param.name: local-ip
param.doc: Configure the Local IP Address for xUA

param.name: A.B.C.D
param.doc: IPv4 Address to use for XUA

param.name: X:X::X:X
param.doc: IPv6 Address to use for XUA

param.name: accept-asp-connections
param.doc: Define what kind of ASP connections to accept

param.name: dynamic-permitted
param.doc: Accept any connection and dynamically create an ASP definition

param.name: description
param.doc: Save human-readable description of the object

param.name: .TEXT
param.doc: Text until the end of the line

command.id: update route POINT_CODE MASK linkset LS_NAME [priority PRIO] [qos-class (CLASS|default)]

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: numbering-plan-indicator
param.doc: Set Global Title Numbering Plan Indicator

param.name: nature-of-address-indicator
param.doc: Set Global Title Nature of Address Indicator

param.name: policy
param.doc: Set the scheduling policy to use for the process

param.name: rr
param.doc: Use the SCHED_RR real-time scheduling algorithm

param.name: cpu-affinity
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on a (group of) thread(s)

param.name: self
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on thread running the VTY

param.name: all
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on all process' threads
Set CPU affinity mask on a thread with specified PID

param.name: THREADNAME
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on a thread with specified thread name

param.name: [delay]
param.doc: If set, delay applying the affinity mask now and let the app handle it at a later point
